intro: Erodendrum longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved erodium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments.
